reports.title: Coffee Futures Market Weekly Update
reports.subtitle: Weekly Market Trends
reports.summary: KCH26 consolidates around 381.20 cents, ICE certified stocks at 398,645 bags marking 1.75-year low, continued market volatility due to Brazil dry weather and US tariff withdrawal completion

reports.title: 2026 Coffee Market Outlook
reports.subtitle: Annual Coffee Market Forecast for 2026
reports.summary: The 2026 coffee market enters a high-cost new normal era due to La Niña transition, EUDR 1-year delay, and structural logistics challenges. While EUDR delay reduces regulatory supply shock risk, this report analyzes 5 key drivers, scenario-based price forecasts, and strategic responses for roasters/traders.

reports.title: Coffee Futures Market Weekly Update
reports.subtitle: Weekly Market Trends
reports.summary: Mar 26 contract (KCH26) continues weekly weakness at 369.45 cents. Trump administration completely removes 40% Brazil coffee tariff on Nov 21, causing market turbulence. Vietnam flooding kills 16, disrupts harvest. Brazil rain forecast triggers 3.3% drop on Nov 19. ICE stocks at historic low of 406k bags. Extreme backwardation analysis (Dec 400¢ vs Mar 369¢). Mar contract fair value 385-395 cents, currently undervalued.

reports.title: Coffee Futures Market Weekly Update
reports.subtitle: Weekly Market Trends
reports.summary: Dec contract closes at 399.80 cents with weekly weakness. Trump administration retroactively removes coffee, beef, and fruit tariffs on Nov 14, triggering 4% price drop. Brazil 50% tariff remains, maintaining structural supply tightness. ICE stocks at historic low of 406,129 bags. StoneX forecasts 70.7M bags for 2026/27, Brazil 2025/26 sales at 62%.

reports.title: Coffee Futures Market Weekly Update
reports.subtitle: Weekly Market Trends
reports.summary: Market update as of November 7

reports.title: Coffee Futures Market Weekly Update
reports.subtitle: Weekly Market Trends
reports.summary: Arabica coffee prices adjust slightly to 392.05 cents. Brazil-US trade negotiation progress expectations and rainfall forecast create short-term downward pressure. ICE Arabica stocks at 19-month low of 465,910 bags, maintaining structural tightness.

reports.title: Coffee Futures Market Weekly Update
reports.subtitle: Weekly Market Trends
reports.summary: Trump-Lula meeting opens tariff negotiation breakthrough. Sep contract hits 403 cents as ICE stocks reach historic lows. Brazil-US tariff easing negotiations emerge as key market variable.

reports.title: Coffee Futures Market Weekly Update
reports.subtitle: Weekly Market Trends
reports.summary: Closes higher at 397 cents, stock decline and tariff negotiation expectations intersect

reports.title: Coffee Futures Market Weekly Update
reports.subtitle: Weekly Market Trends
reports.summary: December Arabica coffee futures maintain high price levels at 373.05 cents. ICE stocks plunge to 1.5-year low and Brazil 2025/26 crop forecast revised down, intensifying supply shortage concerns. US 50% tariff on Brazil reshapes global supply chain, though Vietnam production recovery maintains structural bullish market outlook.

reports.title: Coffee Futures Market Weekly Update
reports.subtitle: Weekly Market Trends
reports.summary: December Arabica coffee futures rise 3.35% WoW to 390.75 cents. Brazil drought persistence and ICE stock decline intensify supply shortage concerns, approaching 400 cent breakthrough.

reports.title: Coffee Futures Market Weekly Update
reports.subtitle: Weekly Market Trends
reports.summary: Surges to 378 cents, ICE stocks at 1.5-year low

reports.title: No Coffee Tax Act In-Depth Analysis: Legislative Feasibility and Strategic Implications
reports.subtitle: Political Reality and Alternative Pathways for Don Bacon-Ro Khanna Bipartisan Bill
reports.summary: In-depth analysis of the 'No Coffee Tax Act' legislative prospects against Trump administration's coffee tariffs. Amid political realities of Republican-majority Congress and presidential veto, the bill's true value lies in public education and opinion formation. Practical relief is more likely through Supreme Court IEEPA ruling and administrative exemptions.

reports.title: Coffee Futures Market Weekly Update
reports.subtitle: Weekly Market Trends
reports.summary: Mid-September, seeking inflection point after historic plunge

reports.title: Coffee Futures Sharp Decline Market Diagnosis - Brazil Rainfall Forecast and Position Adjustment
reports.subtitle: Background and Market Analysis of September 17 Arabica 7.56% Drop
reports.summary: On September 17, 2025, ICE Arabica December contract fell 7.56% to close at 378.40 cents. Rainfall forecasts for Brazil's major coffee regions eased recent supply shortage concerns, triggering speculative position adjustments. Post-Fed rate cut dollar strength added downward pressure. Short-term volatility expected, though structural supply-demand imbalance remains valid.

reports.title: Coffee Market Surge: The Compressed Spring Explodes
reports.subtitle: Perfect Storm Created by Supply Shortage and Geopolitical Tensions
reports.summary: ICE Arabica futures surged to 417.65 cents per pound on September 15, setting a new 52-week high. Brazil weather anomalies causing Arabica supply shortage, ICE certified stocks at 16-month low, and US tariffs on Brazilian coffee combine to form a classic 'compressed spring' scenario. This report analyzes the structural bullish environment created by 5 consecutive years of supply deficit and solid premium coffee demand, projecting short-term targets of 440 cents and 520 cents in extreme scenarios.

reports.title: Coffee Futures Market Weekly Update
reports.subtitle: Brazil Exports Decline 9th Consecutive Month as US Tariff Impact Drives Price Surge
reports.summary: Coffee futures continue rally as US 50% tariff takes full effect. December Arabica coffee (KCZ25) rose 2.78% to 396.85 cents. Brazil exports decline for 9th consecutive month, materializing supply disruption. August Brazil coffee exports fell 17.5% YoY to 3.14M bags, with US exports plunging 46%. Rising ICE trading costs and BRL strength support price increases.

reports.title: Coffee Futures Market: Volatility Seeking Equilibrium
reports.subtitle: Delicate Balance Between Speculative Overheating and Fundamental Tightening
reports.summary: Coffee market shows 2-week consolidation in 370-375 cent range after August's 31% surge. Market balances strong bullish factors (Brazil Arabica production -11.2%, US 50% tariff) against bearish pressures (record Robusta harvest, excessive speculative net longs at 35,708 contracts). Most likely scenario is volatile range-bound trading at 350-410 cents (60% probability), with directional breakout unlikely without new catalyst.

reports.title: Coffee Futures Market Weekly Update
reports.subtitle: CFTC Speculative Capital Surge and CONAB Downgrade Support Market
reports.summary: Coffee futures enter sideways phase with reduced volatility following previous surge rally. December Arabica coffee (KCZ25) closed at 373.65 cents, supported by CONAB's 4.9% downward revision of Brazil Arabica production and 57% surge in CFTC Managed Money net longs (20,663→32,453 contracts). ICE Arabica stocks hit 1.25-year low, but additional upside momentum limited by Brazil harvest 94.9% complete and improved rainfall.

reports.title: Coffee Futures Market Weekly Update
reports.subtitle: CFTC Data Shows Speculative Inflows and Technical Correction Phase Analysis
reports.summary: August coffee market surged to 386.10 cents driven by tariff shock and supply shortage concerns with massive speculative inflows (CFTC Managed Money +4,000 contracts), but entered short-term correction phase due to Brazil harvest completion (Arabica 98%, Robusta 100%) and technical overbought signals. ICE stock shortage (Arabica 717,113 bags, Robusta 6,614 lots) and US 50% tariff impact remain structural bullish factors, with sideways or slight correction expected near 350 cent support.

reports.title: Coffee Futures Market Surge Dissected Through Technical Analysis
reports.subtitle: Complex Interplay of ICE Futures Mechanics and Speculative Capital
reports.summary: Deep dive into recent historic coffee futures surge (52-week range 224.75-399.65 cents/lb) from technical analysis perspective. Analyzes 'short covering rally' mechanism triggered when fundamental shocks of Brazil climate change and US tariffs met structural vulnerabilities of ICE certified stock lows and excessive speculative short positions, with detailed COT report data.

reports.title: Coffee Futures Market Weekly Update
reports.subtitle: Brazil Tariff and Bullish Momentum Continue
reports.summary: Coffee futures hit 2.25-month high on Brazil 50% tariff shock and weather concerns. December Arabica coffee (KCZ25) surged over 30% in August to 378.30 cents, reflecting structural changes in ICE physical delivery market. Brazil's massive supply pool disappearing due to tariffs spreads supply shortage concerns across market.

reports.title: Perfect Storm: Coffee Price Surge Deep Dive
reports.subtitle: Coffee Futures Market Weekly Update
reports.summary: Analysis of H2 2025 coffee market's perfect storm. Deep dive into factors causing historic price surge as climate change, supply chain crisis, and demand surge occur simultaneously.

reports.title: Coffee Futures Market Weekly Update
reports.subtitle: Weekly Market Trends
reports.summary: September Arabica coffee (KCU25) closed at 341.65 cents, recording 6.33% monthly gain. US 50% tariff on Brazil coffee (effective Aug 1) and Cerrado Mineiro frost combined to maximize supply concerns. CFTC Managed Money net longs increased to 22,466 contracts, supporting bullish momentum.

reports.title: US Brazil Tariff Shock: Navigating the Crossroads of Global Coffee Market
reports.subtitle: In-depth Analysis Report
reports.summary: With US imposing unprecedented 50% tariff on all Brazil imports, global coffee market stands at crossroads where two powerful opposing forces collide. Brazil supply surplus creating downward price pressure clashes with upward pressure from ICE 'C' futures CTD mechanism recalibration. Watch for potential spot-futures price divergence due to declining futures trading appeal.

reports.title: Coffee Futures Market Weekly Update
reports.subtitle: Post-Brazil Tariff Implementation Surge, 8.7% Weekly Gain to 308.95 cents
reports.summary: Coffee futures surge to 308.95 cents on Brazil 50% tariff implementation (Aug 6) and Minas Gerais weather concerns. Closing at +3.74% daily on Aug 8, weekly gain of 8.7%. China approves 183 new Brazil coffee companies as trade flow restructuring accelerates. US coffee prices expected to rise 15-20% from tariff implementation, accelerating global supply chain diversification.

reports.title: In-Depth Analysis: US-Brazil Tariff Dispute Impact on Coffee Market
reports.subtitle: 50% Tariff Threat and Global Supply Chain Restructuring Outlook
reports.summary: Multi-faceted analysis of market impact from US 1-week delay of 50% Brazil coffee tariff. Comprehensive review of ICE futures vs ICO spot market divergence, Brazil's irreplaceable role, US roasters' cost shock. Tariff threat stems from political motives, with short-term market disruption and long-term supply chain restructuring potential.

reports.title: Coffee Futures Market Weekly Update
reports.subtitle: Closes at 284.20 cents Amid Brazil Tariff Delay, Global Trade Flow Restructuring Accelerates
reports.summary: Coffee futures close lower at 284.20 cents despite Brazil 50% tariff implementation delay (to Aug 6). US Brazil tariff delayed from Aug 1 to Aug 6 but will be implemented without exemptions, fundamentally restructuring global coffee trade flows. While Brazil 2025/26 production revised up (Conab 55.7M bags), export shift to China and EU accelerating.

reports.title: Coffee Futures Price Prediction Model Analysis
reports.subtitle: Statistical Model Analysis
reports.summary: Multiple linear regression analysis for coffee futures price prediction confirms USD/BRL exchange rate has dominant influence explaining 84.3% of total price variation. Model achieves 79.5% prediction accuracy, with Brazil's structural characteristic of 40% global coffee production manifesting in exchange rate-centric pricing mechanism. CFTC speculative positions, NVDI crop health, and dollar index serve as additional explanatory variables.

reports.title: Coffee Futures Market Weekly Update
reports.subtitle: Short-term Rise Then Mixed, Extreme Short Positions vs Harvest Completion Contrast
reports.summary: Coffee futures show mixed performance after short-term rise on Brazil frost concerns, maximizing market volatility. September Arabica (KCU25) fell 2.39% to 297.55 cents on July 25, though reaching 1-week high mid-week with extreme volatility. US 50% Brazil tariff announcement and funds' extreme short positions (2-year max) compound market confusion.

reports.title: Standing Against the Giant Wave: In-Depth Analysis of Global Coffee Market Structural Changes and Future Outlook
reports.subtitle: Global Coffee Market Structural Changes and Future Outlook
reports.summary: In-depth analysis of root causes behind unprecedented price rises and volatility facing global coffee market, with future outlook and strategic implications. With US-Brazil 50% tariff just 1 week away, addresses structural supply-demand imbalance across both Arabica and Robusta varieties and strategic responses to new market paradigm.

reports.title: Coffee Futures Market Weekly Update
reports.subtitle: Sep Contract Rebounds 6% to 303.60 cents, Mixed Market Signals Amid Tariff Waves and Brazil Harvest Completion
reports.summary: Coffee futures rebound 6% from last week's low (286.50¢) to 303.60 cents in volatile trading. Trump's Brazil tariff threat eases while Brazil harvest reaches 74% completion, but ICE stock decline and Volcafe's persistent deficit forecast (8.5M bags) provide downside support. Coffee companies begin passing tariff burden to consumer prices, with 300 cent psychological resistance recovery key to short-term direction.

reports.title: Coffee Crisis Begins: Complete 50% Tariff Shock Analysis
reports.subtitle: In-Depth Analysis of Chain Effects on US Futures Market and Consumers from Trump Administration's 50% Tariff on Brazilian Coffee
reports.summary: Infographic providing in-depth analysis of Trump administration's 50% tariff on Brazilian coffee (effective Aug 1, 2025). Based on past copper tariff case, projects this measure could spike US coffee futures (KC) prices to 355.5-385.0 cents short-term. Visually explains 'Cheapest-to-Deliver (CTD)' reshuffling mechanism as key price driver, comprehensively covering supply chain, roaster, consumer chain effects, participant-specific strategies, and counter-scenario where prices may not rise.

reports.title: Coffee Futures Market Weekly Update
reports.subtitle: Sep Contract 286.50 cents, Extreme Volatility from Trump Tariff Threat vs Brazil Harvest Pressure
reports.summary: Coffee futures drop to 7.5-month low (286.80¢) on accelerating Brazil harvest, but Trump's 50% Brazil tariff threat emerges as new variable. Per Safras & Mercado, Brazil harvest 69% complete expanding supply pressure, with Aug 1 tariff implementation key variable for short-term direction. Vietnam export recovery (+4.1%) and Robusta 14-month low signal continued supply improvement, suggesting 280-300 cent range volatility ahead.

reports.title: Coffee Futures Price Direction Check
reports.subtitle: Entering Correction Phase, Bullish vs Bearish Factor Analysis and Scenario Outlook
reports.summary: Coffee futures (KCU25) enter correction phase with 21.5% drop to 284.30¢ over 1 month. Short-term bearish factors like Brazil harvest pressure and Robusta oversupply prevail, but medium-long term bullish factors including structural Arabica shortage and La Niña risk (41% probability) remain solid. Short-term 275-305¢ range expected, with 274¢ key support defense determining future direction.

reports.title: Coffee Futures Market Weekly Update
reports.subtitle: Weekly Market Trends
reports.summary: Coffee futures continue decline on accelerating Brazil harvest and ample supply outlook. September Arabica coffee (KCU25) fell 4.56% WoW to 289.90 cents. Smooth Brazil coffee harvest progress and surging Indonesia Robusta exports pressure market with supply increase factors.

reports.title: Arabica Coffee Futures (KCU25) at Crossroads: Short-term Supply Pressure vs Underlying Support Analysis
reports.subtitle: 300 cents Battle and Brazil Harvest Season Market Dynamics
reports.summary: Arabica coffee futures in fierce battle at 300 cent resistance. Short-term supply pressure from Brazil harvest collides with underlying bullish factors including structural shortage and logistics bottlenecks, reaching key inflection point to determine market direction over next 2-4 weeks.

reports.title: Coffee Futures Market Weekly Update
reports.subtitle: Weekly Market Trends
reports.summary: Coffee futures continue sharp decline on accelerating Brazil harvest and ample supply outlook. September Arabica coffee (KCU25) fell 3.5% WoW to 303.75 cents, hitting 6.75-month low.

reports.title: Coffee Prices: Calm Before the Storm
reports.subtitle: Coffee Futures Market Update
reports.summary: Arabica coffee market signals high volatility ahead as strong bullish factors collide with potential bearish risks. Global coffee stocks approaching historic lows, with short-term price outlook at 310-390 cents.

reports.title: Coffee Futures Market Weekly Update
reports.subtitle: Weekly Market Trends
reports.summary: Coffee futures continue sharp decline on Brazil harvest progress and global supply expansion outlook. September Arabica coffee (KCU25) hits post-January low at 315.05 cents, Robusta falls to 13-month low.

reports.title: Short-term Coffee Futures Price Forecast and Direction Check
reports.subtitle: Short-term Coffee Futures Price Forecast
reports.summary: KCN25 rises 0.60% to 349.90 cents, recovering above first support (344.83 cents). Short-term, Brazil harvest progress (28% complete) and speculative shorts (-37,065 contracts) create downward pressure, but structurally, global Arabica deficit of 8.5M bags and 25-year low stocks remain bullish factors.

reports.title: Coffee Futures Market Weekly Update
reports.subtitle: Weekly Market Trends
reports.summary: Coffee futures test key support on Brazil harvest progress and Vietnam export increase. July Arabica coffee (KCN25) trades at 347.80 cents, down 2.85 cents (-0.81%) from previous day.

reports.title: Coffee Futures Market Weekly Update
reports.subtitle: Weekly Market Trends
reports.summary: Coffee futures decline Friday on Brazil harvest progress and Vietnam export increase. July Arabica coffee (KCN25) fell 1.70 points (-0.47%), July ICE Robusta coffee (RMN25) plunged 153 points (-3.33%).

reports.title: Coffee Futures Market Weekly Update
reports.subtitle: Weekly Market Trends
reports.summary: Weekly analysis report of coffee futures market. Includes global supply-demand status, price movement factors, and technical analysis.
